item.title: Fly-Tipping, 27th June
item.description:
I am writing to report a serious rubbish issue on both corners of Charlesfield and Alderesgrove Avenue. The waste has been left there for quite some time, and unfortunately, no one has taken any action to remove it. This build-up is now attracting rats and poses a clear health risk to the community. It also looks unsightly and reflects poorly on the local area and its residents. Why has this been ignored for so long? The local community deserves a clean and safe environment. I would appreciate it if this could be treated as a priority and cleared as soon

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlesfield, Chinbrook, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barriers left behind after street works two or three weeks ago, 27th June
item.description:
When the work was completed a pile of waste was left protected by barriers. The waste was quickly collected but the barriers appear to have been forgotten as they are still obstructing the road. This is outside 29/31 Mayfield Avenue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Towncourt Lane, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
